title: Energy stored with dielectric in capacitor

content.description: The circuit shown above has three capacitors and a <math alttext="12 volt" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> battery. The capacitors are charged to steady state conditions.
content.question: One of the capacitors is removed from the circuit and isolated. While it still holds all of its charge, a piece of ceramic with dielectric constant of <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is inserted and completely fills the space between the plates. <math alttext="U sub i " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext></mtext><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is the energy stored in the capacitor before the dielectric was inserted, and <math alttext="U sub f " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is the energy stored in the capacitor after the dielectric was inserted. What is the ratio <math alttext="U sub f over U sub i" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>U</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>i</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
